snippet: Mr. Bao, 16, was trying to escape through Myanmar when he was detained and is now at his grandparents’ home in Inner Mongolia, a family friend said.
abstract: Bao Zhuoxuan, son of imprisoned human rights lawyer Wang Yu, is living under house arrest at his grandparent's northern China home; 16-year-old was caught trying to escape to United States through Myanmar; his detention is seen as way to pressure Yu to cooperate with Chinese authorities.

byline.contributor: Mia Li contributed research from Beijing.

lead_paragraph: Mr. Bao, 16, was trying to escape through Myanmar when he was detained and is now at his grandparents’ home in Inner Mongolia, a family friend said.

headline.main: Bao Zhuoxuan, Son of Rights Lawyer Held in China, Is Said to Be Under House Arrest
headline.print_headline: China Is Said to Confine Rights Lawyer’s Son

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Human Rights and Human Rights Violations
